WRITING.TITLE: This is seriously too cool. Never would have imagined something like this back during Freelancer days

WRITING.TEXT: 1. The entire planet is city pretty much, and you can fly right down to above the top of the buildings, but if you get too close it's considered a restricted area, the textures aren't as detailed on the parts of the planet that are just city filler essentially. Then there are designated areas you can fly around buildings and it's not restricted, can land on some roofs and things. Then there is area 18 which is a pretty large area you can land, get out, explore, there's shops, npcs, and missions. 1.2. I would assume they have a lot of plans with them 2. ArcCorp is the only city planet right now. There's plans for others though. 3. See above 4. Area 18 has npcs, if you fly down on other parts you'll see some space cars traffic . 5. Yep, you see the lights from space as well, looks awesome
I'll do better next time!
>Lectio divina Please elaborate, I am curious.
They reappear for me if I unequip my flight suit and re-equip. Unfortunately the mission cancels though so it's not able to be completed either way.

This is almost point blank what me and my wife went through. As others said, she probably is cheating or has cheated at least in an emotional way. It probably hasn't really been a 14-month thing, but she's got some level of dissatisfaction and has found a way out. My wife is bipolar as well, and you say she has times of depression. It may be more serious than that. You also mentioned trying for kids, and not having success. This affects my wife and I tremendously as well, we've tried for years with no luck. It really hurts my wife, consider that pain of hers as you process all this as well. Consider that you may be much more at fault than you realize, was the case for me. I was too overbearing, didn't communicate enough my feelings, developed an apathy for my relationship and the things she was doing. Realize you can't control her but you are in control somewhat of her surroundings, and yourself. Be an example, pray like never before, and get Godly friends or parents involved. My wife ended up separating and moved to California for a couple months to live with her sister. I'm very fortunate to have very Godly in-laws that were able to have some influence with her. We're since back together and coming on our next marriage anniversary and that rough patch has totally transformed our marriage for the better. My wife also had an alcohol addiction to face. If your wife is going out all the time like you say, chances are she does too, and it's affected her mental health much worse. Brother, I'll be praying for you. Now more than ever, be on your knees pleading with God. Get every Godly man and friend you know surrounding you with love and prayer. Don't be afraid to reach out for help. God doesn't want to see marriages fail, he can save yours, and transform your wife's heart. Hang in there.

Our hair looks similar, I also live in a very humid climate. Trying different pomades got me to some good ones that keep my hair up, some work great, some don't. Some work for a month then don't work as well anymore. I recently started using Bonafide pomade on a recommendation on my barber. Their Matte Paste works best for me. They also have a clay if you need more hold, but recommend that matte paste as it's more natural looking. ​ Link: [https://bonafidepomade.com/collections/pomade/products/bona-fide-pomade-matte-paste-4oz](https://bonafidepomade.com/collections/pomade/products/bona-fide-pomade-matte-paste-4oz)
Give some recommendations, please :)

Did you go to Nipton? I did the same trip a couple months ago. Started in goodsprings and took the same route as the game. Nipton is nothing like the game lol, but was definitely my favorite location, super cool, quiet little town. And was sad to learn there's no such thing as Novac, with giant trex gift shop
Wat

I build software for the merchant services industry, and also sell the software I create paired up with merchant accounts. It's really a simple industry to get into, not majorly affected by recessions, and excellent residual income. All can be done on the road, and actually, I have a significant advantage on the road as I always have a new client base to work with when we move every month or so. I also have subreps that sell under me that I visit, train, and work with throughout the year. The biggest key is having an excellent MSP back home that handles most of the support and deployment for my merchants.

My understanding of it is that when we die, immediately we are in judgement before God making a case for our life on Earth. If we are saved, then Jesus, mediating on our behalf, since he has taken our punishment at the cross, atoned for our sin and we are heirs of his righteousness and are granted access to Heaven to wait out the second Coming of the Lord, which afterwards we are raised to life again and the Earth and universe is replaced with the New Heavens and New Earth, where we will then live out the rest of our eternity, with God being our focal point and source of worship and light. If we are not saved, then we face eternal damnation and torment. I could be completely off tho. Could also be that we "sleep" until the second Coming where we are then raised to life again, taken to Heaven and face judgement, wait out the Second Coming events, and then descend back to the "new heavens, new earth". The immediate judgement makes more sense to me though.

WRITING.TITLE: What to tackle next in the backlog?
WRITING.TEXT: Hello! I've got a serious backlog of games. I've been trying to finish Witcher 3 + DLC fully and I've got to Blood and Wine and I am spent, don't know if I keep going on just that game, great as it is. But I might finish that first if you guys think it's the most worthy endeavor. ​ In my queue to finish I've got: * Witcher 3: Blood and Wine * Dark Souls: Remastered (Never beat it, have played up to Anor Londo), followed by DS2:SotFS (got to Drangleic Castle), and DS3 (Haven't played) * Deus Ex (original, never played), Deus Ex: HR (Got up to the boss fight with Yelena long time ago), followed by Deus Ex: Mankind Divided (Played a short bit) * Dishonored (played up to the first main area I guess, don't remember much), followed by Dishonored 2 (never played) * Divinity Original Sin (Been playing on and off, need to finish), followed by D:OS 2 (Never played, heard the great reviews) * DOOM (Never played) * Hitman 2 (New one, including all the Hitman 1 map) * Kingdom Come: Deliverance * Prey While we're here, anyone got backlog tackling tips?
Thanks for the Dark Souls recommendation (you and others), forgot how amazing this game was, definitely what I needed for a breather.
Maybe this is cliche, but the Paul Washer - Shocking Youth Message sermon. Listened to it as a youth, and was shocked. It definitely impacted me for a lifetime and set things in perspective.

Awesome! Sounds a lot like my wife and I. We were best friends for a year and half about before we started dating. Dated 4 months, engaged only 20 days! No elopement either, we planned the wedding that fast. I also say go sooner than later. The best thing you can do if you're serious is get some hardcore premarital counseling where the tough questions will be asked, and it'll help you get a much deeper understanding of each other, and set some boundaries before marriage that'll help you a lifetime! Ask your pastor for recommendations or if he does premarital counseling himself!
Is there more payoff to donate whole carcasses or skin them first?

Escape from Tarkov

Was there a point in the process doing OMAD you couldn't just eat whatever and keep losing? My general thought was KETO OMAD but I haven't really had the time for cooking since I started and also can't cook for shit. I'm on 6 days in, no slip ups yet. OMAD has been the easiest plan to follow ever for me, mainly because I've been eating whatever I wanted to stuff myself full once hr 23 rolls around. I tracked the calories on what I would say has been my worst day so far (Taco Bell and Oreos -1700 kcal) and even then I was under my calorie goal and I've lost some weight already. I did cut soda and creamers out completely, just been water and black coffee. But I dunno I feel like I'm cheating and it won't work long term. Your thoughts?

Sounds good, thanks bro! Def not fast food every time, but I love that if I do need something quick like that or I get invited out to eat I can have whatever I'd usually eat and still be on track. That's why OMAD so far for me has worked way better than the 16:8, I find it way easier. What would an average KETO meal look like for you to hit your daily calories?
Hell yea, blackened tenders with the blackened ranch is my shit lol. Thanks man, appreciate the feedback. Congrats on the weight loss you look great!

Yeah this, and they also do what's called chuffing. Small house cats don't do it, but pretty much all big cats do. It's this breathy low rumble sound and it's a confirmation that the cat is comfortable with you or the situation. Humans can mimic a chuff too and have the cat chuff back. It's basically the big cat equivalent to a pur. Video - https://youtu.be/5Ksr0-H1gmI
